application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; New York, NY, USA
description:
People Operations strives to revolutionize human resources the same way that Google has revolutionized search. We are helping to find, grow and keep the remarkable assemblage of talent who are our Googlers. You'll be an advocate of Google's culture and values, partnering with our business leaders to help them build their organizations and make sure all people decisions are based on data. Whether coaching our clients on how to lead their teams, navigating and resolving employee relations issues or managing programs that help develop our Googlers, you are exceptionally focused on putting them first, and being as clear and transparent as possible to help Googlers understand how people decisions get made.

Our Performance Management system helps organize and direct Googlers’ effort, improve their performance, and reinforce our culture. Specifically, our team provides a platform for Googlers to give and receive developmental feedback, enables the fair measurement of contributions and impact, and facilitates promotion decisions.

In this role, you will work well in a fast-paced, ambiguous, and complex environments, demonstrating excellent relationship management skills and experience in performance management, building and managing a team. You will be responsible for leading the Performance Design team toward the next iteration of Performance management at Google, including defining the vision and long-term roadmap, managing executive stakeholders across Google, and providing thought leadership to ensure evidence-based practices drive the future of Performance, Promotion, and Feedback.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Organizational Behavior or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of relevant work experience with 3 years of performance management design.
  • 5 years of people management experience.
  • Experience working with People Analytics.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in project and relationships management within a fast-paced environment. Experience running experiments in a business context.
  • Experience partnering and collaboration across teams and organizational boundaries to get things done in a matrixed environment.
  • Ability to demonstrate impact and efficacy of performance management interventions on the business.
  • Ability to work with tight timelines and keep a continual awareness of change management.
  • Passion for people and business development.
  • Excellent analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Be responsible for the design and operationalization of Google’s performance management philosophy, drawing from academic research, industry best practice, as well as internal research and experiments.
  • Accountable for the future of our Performance Design efforts. This includes setting the long-term vision and roadmap, ensuring each team member’s portfolio of work fits together seamlessly to work toward team goals, managing executive stakeholders and collaborating across Google.
  • Manage relationships with key partners (HR, People Development, Corporate Engineering, etc.) and others across Google who are contributing to the team’s projects, and/or play a role in implementing them.
  • Lead a team of high-performers over whose portfolios of work you are accountable.
  • Be accountable for the successful rollout of changes to internal systems at a company wide level, in collaboration with Communications, People Development, HR, etc.
title: Leader, Performance Management Design
